Posts.Content: Lauren1 wrote: Hi to all, This is my first time posting to this list.  I finished neo-adjuvant therapy with Taxotere and Cytoxan at the end of July, then had surgery in August and radiation which finished last month.  My "boyfriend" at the time asked me to leave the house I'd shared with he and his kids for two years, just at the same time of diagnosis in the spring and so I was nearly homeless, all alone in a new state and moving from place-to-place during treatment.   Now I'm starting over in yet a third place at 53.  Now that I'm embarking on this new adventure, I'm concerned that my hair is seemingly coming in slowly and no eyebrows at all. I've just started Tamoxifen.  Advice and ideas and exeriences?  Thanks and blessings and happy holidays to all! Dx 4/22/2011, IDC, 2cm, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Four months since Taxotere & Cytoxan, hair issues.... Lauren1 Elizabeth1889

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2011 05:44AM Lauren1 wrote: Dear Madison, I had 4 rounds of Taxotere and Cytoxan.  As my boyfriend had asked me to leave the house and I was all alone in a new state, I was very nervous.  Although I don't like taking medication or drugs at this point in my life (I'm 53), the oncologists prescribed a low dosage of Ativan just for the period of the infusions.  I'm now 4 months past the last chemotherapy infusion and I no longer take any medication, and the panic attacks have stopped, too.   Blessings and best and sending healing doves, Lauren
Posts.Title: Does the nervousness ever go away? MadisoninMd MadisoninMd
